quote: I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.
author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Some people are oil and water.
author: John Christopher,  The Pool of Fire

quote: People who get up early in the morning cause war, death and famine.
author: Banksy,  Banging Your Head Against a Brick Wall

quote: To summarize the summary of the summary: people are a problem.
author: Douglas Adams,  The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

quote: People, generally, suck.
author: Christopher Moore,  The Stupidest Angel: A Heartwarming Tale of Christmas Terror

quote: There are three types of people in this world. Firstly, there are people who make things happen. Then there are people who watch things happen. Lastly, there are people who ask, what happened? Which do you want to be?
author: Steve Backley,  The Champion in all of Us: 12 Rules for Success

quote: Some people have lives; some people have music.
author: John Green,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson

quote: Everyone who got to where they are had to begin where they were.
author: Richard Paul Evans

quote: There are two kinds of people in this world: Those who believe there are two kinds of people in this world and those who are smart enough to know better.
author: Tom Robbins,  Still Life with Woodpecker

quote: a group of people who individually can do nothing but as a group decide that nothing can be done
author: Fred Allen

quote: A person is a person through other persons.None of us comes into the world fully formed. We would not know how to think, or walk, or speak, or behave as human beings unless we learned it from other human beings. We need other human beings in order to be human. I am because other people are. A person is entitled to a stable community life, and the first of these communities is the family.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: there are three kinds of people in the world: those who don't know and don't know they don't know; those who don't know and do know they don't know; and those who know and know how much they still don't know.
author: Karen Marie Moning,  Bloodfever

quote: People are basically irritating. Myself included.
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Devil May Cry

quote: There are many people who can do big things, but there are very few people who will do the small things.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among mysteries.
author: Theodore Roethke,  Straw for the Fire: From the Notebooks of Theodore Roethke

quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice in Wonderland

quote: You take people, you put them on a journey, you give them peril, you find out who they really are.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: People are the most difficult thing in the world to change
author: Gena Showalter,  Oh My Goth

quote: The most amazing people are those who love life and humanity.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Whoever saves one life, saves the world entire.
author: Thomas Keneally,  Schindler's List

quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: People who get involved with the success of something have to be given at least some share of that success.
author: Michael Ironside

quote: Name the different kinds of people,’ said Miss Lupescu. ‘Now.’Bod thought for a moment. ‘The living,’ he said. ‘Er. The dead.’ He stopped. Then, ‘... Cats?’ he offered, uncertainly.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book

quote: People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

quote: Everyone is the other and no one is himself.
author: Martin Heidegger,  Being and Time

quote: Those people who develop the ability to continuously acquire new and better forms of knowledge that they can apply to their work and to their lives will be the movers and shakers in our society for the indefinite future.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: There Are Two Typos Of People In This World: Those Who Can Edit And Those Who Can’t
author: Jarod Kintz,  There are Two Typos of People in This World: Those Who Can Edit and Those Who Can't

quote: Anybody who succeeds is helping people. The secret to success is find a need and fill it; find a hurt and heal it; find a problem and solve it.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: When you don't know what the answer is, you know *Who* the answer is.
author: Larry Burkett

quote: At the end of the day, the questions we ask of ourselves determine the type of people that we will become.
author: Leo Babauta

quote: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: We are a society of notoriously unhappy people: lonely, anxious, depressed, destructive, dependent — people who are glad when we have killed the time we are trying so hard to save.
author: Erich Fromm,  To Have or to Be? The Nature of the Psyche

quote: There are two kinds of people I don't trust: people who don't drink and people who collect stickers.
author: Chelsea Handler,  My Horizontal Life: A Collection of One-Night Stands

quote: People who lean on logic and philosophy and rational exposition end by starving the best part of the mind.
author: W.B. Yeats

quote: There is a collective as well as an individual humor inclining peoples to sadness or cheerfulness, making them see things in bright or somber lights. In fact, only society can pass a collective opinion on the value of human life; for this the individual is incompetent.
author: Emile Durkheim

quote: Each person must live their life as a model for others.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Do we know our poor people? Do we know the poor in our house, in our family? Perhaps they are not hungry for a piece of bread. Perhaps our children, husband, wife, are not hungry, or naked, or dispossessed, but are you sure there is no one there who feels unwanted, deprived of affection?
author: Mother Teresa,  Heart of Joy

quote: There are two typos of people in this world: those who can edit, and those who can't.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: There seem to be only two kinds of people: Those who think that metaphors are facts, and those who know that they are not facts. Those who know they are not facts are what we call "atheists,"and those who think they are facts are "religious."Which group really gets the message?
author: Joseph Campbell,  Thou Art That: Transforming Religious Metaphor

quote: The rare few, who, early in life have rid themselves of the friendship of the many.
author: James Whistler

quote: Bad people are, from the point of view of art, fascinating studies. They represent colour, variety and strangeness. Good people exasperate one's reason; bad people stir one's imagination.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Those who trust us educate us.
author: George Eliot,  Daniel Deronda

quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
author: George Santayana

quote: Only the living can read. This means that when I write, my target market is people of the future. Greetings, people of the moon!
author: Jarod Kintz,  At even one penny, this book would be overpriced. In fact, free is too expensive, because you'd still waste time by reading it.

quote: In my life so far, I have discovered that there are really only two kinds of people: those who are for you, and those who are against you. Learn to recognize them, for they are often and easily mistaken for each other.
author: Lemmy Kilmister

quote: Once you do away with the idea of people as fixed, static entities, then you see that people can change, and there is hope.
author: bell hooks

quote: Those who reach for the Sun, usually drop the world.
author: Lionel Suggs

quote: If everyone helps to hold up the sky, then one person does not become tired.
author: Askhari Johnson Hodari,  Lifelines: The Black Book of Proverbs

quote: No one can do everything, but everyone can do something
author: Max Lucado,  Outlive Your Life: You Were Made to Make A Difference
